channel.title: Comments on: Learning Ionic
channel.description: Knowing is different & Doing is different

item.title: By: Pavan Alapati
item.dc:creator: Pavan Alapati
item.description: hi Arvind, you blogs are really userfully. we have one problem.We are mobile app developer.We can developled group chat application using cordova-Firebase.But we are stuggeled for one to one chat Please guide to us .We alredy flowed ./../../node-webkit-firebase-simple-social-authentication/index.html . But it's related desktop app Please help to us
item.content:encoded: hi Arvind, you blogs are really userfully. we have one problem.We are mobile app developer.We can developled group chat application using cordova-Firebase.But we are stuggeled for one to one chat Please guide to us .We alredy flowed ./../../node-webkit-firebase-simple-social-authentication/index.html . But it’s related desktop app Please help to us

item.content:encoded: Thanks for pointing out. You can find the server code here https://github.com/learning-ionic/Chapter-6/tree/master/server

item.title: By: Whatheheckman .
item.dc:creator: Whatheheckman .
item.description: On page 190 when setting up the server for the Bookstore App. It says to download and unzip the server code from "https://github.com/arvindr21/ionic-book-store-server". This page leads to a 404 and I don't see the necessary code anywhere else on our GitHub profile. Is there somewhere else I can get this?
item.content:encoded: On page 190 when setting up the server for the Bookstore App. It says to download and unzip the server code from “https://github.com/arvindr21/ionic-book-store-server”. This page leads to a 404 and I don’t see the necessary code anywhere else on our GitHub profile. Is there somewhere else I can get this?

item.title: By: Lucas Corrêa Braz
item.dc:creator: Lucas Corrêa Braz
item.description: The app runs in the browser and cell phone, with ionic serve and ionic run Android. But with ionic upload, The app remains loading and never ends.
item.content:encoded: The app runs in the browser and cell phone, with ionic serve and ionic run Android. But with ionic upload, The app remains loading and never ends.

item.content:encoded: It should technically. What errors are you facing?

item.title: By: Tejaswi Rana
item.dc:creator: Tejaswi Rana
item.description: I'm stuck in running the chat app. I get to the ChatDetailCtrl and $scope.chatToUser is null. I don't understand. I cleared all the online users in firebase, restarted the app, logged in with my gmail account, got to the DashCtrl. When I log the user key it shows what is currently in firebase. Once I click the arrow to take me to the ChatDetailCtrl it stops there. Well obviously there is no "other" user to begin with. So the application logic is flawed. I don't understand how you were able to run in the book. I checked all your sources too.
item.content:encoded: I’m stuck in running the chat app. I get to the ChatDetailCtrl and $scope.chatToUser is null. I don’t understand. I cleared all the online users in firebase, restarted the app, logged in with my gmail account, got to the DashCtrl. When I log the user key it shows what is currently in firebase. Once I click the arrow to take me to the ChatDetailCtrl it stops there. Well obviously there is no “other” user to begin with. So the application logic is flawed. I don’t understand how you were able to run in the book. I checked all your sources too.

item.title: By: sunyuhang
item.dc:creator: sunyuhang
item.description: Great Book! Please help on a couple of questions: 1: Why do you use broadcast events instead of calling functions directly. For example, in controllers.js, you can call addToCard directly. 2: Could you please shed some light on backgrond process?
item.content:encoded:
Great Book! Please help on a couple of questions:
1: Why do you use broadcast events instead of calling functions directly. For example, in controllers.js, you can call addToCard directly.
2: Could you please shed some light on backgrond process?

item.title: By: Magnus Melwin
item.dc:creator: Magnus Melwin
item.content:encoded:
Hey there Arvind, its a good book – worth every cent – just finished reading it. Hope many more to come.

Would love to have a section on handling whitespace in json parsing . Its seems to be quite missed on as a topic everywhere. say for example – how would you handle a json like { “FULLNAME” , “John Smith”} , in ionic it gives me a blank when I try to print it out {{FULLNAME)}} in a view , unless I remove the space in “John Smith”

Mel

item.title: By: Naveen Bellary

item.description: I have a requirement similar to a task mgmt app, when ever a user creates a task all the users assigned to should get notified. What should i be using for this?
item.content:encoded: I have a requirement similar to a task mgmt app, when ever a user creates a task all the users assigned to should get notified. What should i be using for this?

item.title: By: Naveen Bellary
item.dc:creator: Naveen Bellary
item.description:
The messaging app which you have demonstrated in the book don't use push notifications sending message to only a particular device Id?
Can I use Push plugin for this purpose?
item.content:encoded:
The messaging app which you have demonstrated in the book don’t use push notifications sending message to only a particular device Id?

Can I use Push plugin for this purpose?
